In the summer of 1998, as a financial earthquake devastated Asia's economy, the Hong Kong Special Administrative Region (HKSAR) government won a hard-fought battle to defend the Hong Kong dollar and Hang Seng Index (HSI) against speculative attacks led by American billionaire investor George Soros. George Soros walk away with massive losses.

Backed by Beijing, the Hong Kong Monetary Authority (HKMA) made the controversial decision on August 14 to enter the market, buying up 118 billion HK dollars' (15 billion U.S. dollars) worth of stocks and futures in two breathtaking weeks of trading, and eventually driving out international speculators.

These people are the worse violators of all those atrocities of this century.

An individual's hukou status defines his or her rights and eligibility for social welfare and various services, including public education and housing, within a specific administrative unit.
As a result, many rural residents migrate to cities without the allowed hukou, losing access to beneficial government services and often resorting to poor housing conditions. Larger cities often limit new hukou to wealthy households, thus, leaving poorer urban residents with worse living conditions.

11. The government can force entire cities in strict lockdown, closed shops and hospitals , starving citizens, dying patients who require medical attention because they don't have a green health code every 24 hours.
Delays have caused many deaths .
12. Man-made disasters are declared as natural disasters , so that the government will not be financially liable.
Examples, water is suddenly discharged from the dams without early warnings to the residents of Zhengzhou, so they are deemed as natural accidents . Thousands have drowned in the subways and tunnels caused by flash floods, and Billions lost to property damage.

15. People are not protected from bank defaults because the government themselves are bankrupt.
16. Your pension can just easily be stolen by the government because most cities are already bankrupt.

snippet.textDisplay:
China is not safe 2023 :
1. A man was selling a tank-shaped ice cream and was arrested. His social media accounts all suspended .
2. Thousands of people who report on disasters like an outbreak, flood disasters, building fires, and other fatal accidents get arrested and silenced .
3. Human Rights lawyers who defend the innocent and the oppressed are also arrested.
4. You can easily buy a wife or children especially in rural areas of China. Child kidnappings and human trafficking are prevalent. It's a very serious crisis in China.
5. Stand-up comedians get arrested for making fun of the government and its officials.
6. In an economic slump, those who are bankrupt are not protected . They can't declare personal bankruptcy, and become prisoners for life in their own debt . All bank accounts are automatically frozen including Alipay and WeChat Pay.
7. Any behavior that is not in line with the government narrative will get demerits from your social credit score . Having a low score will bar you from many necessities in life like you won't be able to hail a taxi nor book a hotel nor buy a plane ticket.
8. When you do business, you'll be forced by many government officials to pay bribes or else your business won't go anywhere. The result is cutting corners , substandard quality products, Tofu dregs , collapsing buildings and bridges are common.
9. If you can't afford an apartment, then you can't get a Hukou Êà∑Âè£.
Under China's hukou system, each citizen is required to register in one and only one place of (permanent) residence. An individual's hukou status defines his or her rights and eligibility for social welfare and various services, including public education and housing, within a specific administrative unit.
As a result, many rural residents migrate to cities without the allowed hukou, losing access to beneficial government services and often resorting to poor housing conditions. Larger cities often limit new hukou to wealthy households, thus, leaving poorer urban residents with worse living conditions.
10. Planned economy never works, and will affect everyone in society. Èù©ÂëΩ 2.0 Just like the Cultural revolution in the past. All the original CEOs of Tech Giants in China like Alibaba, Tencent, Jingdong , Meituan, Douyin, etc have been forced to stepped down and forced to donate money to the CCP government.
11. The government can force entire cities in strict lockdown, closed shops and hospitals , starving citizens, dying patients who require medical attention because they don't have a green health code every 24 hours.
Delays have caused many deaths .
12. Man-made disasters are declared as natural disasters , so that the government will not be financially liable.
Examples, water is suddenly discharged from the dams without early warnings to the residents of Zhengzhou, so they are deemed as natural accidents . Thousands have drowned in the subways and tunnels caused by flash floods, and Billions lost to property damage.
Government underground drilling caused a building to sink and lean to one side is declared a natural disaster, so that the government doesn't have to compensate homeowners. (Á¢ßÊ°ÇÂõ≠ Country Garden in Tianjin)
13. Bank depositors have lost their life savings in bank scams perpetrated by bank officials in Henan Bank Ê≤≥ÂçóÈì∂Ë°å, and Zhengzhou Bank ÈÉëÂ∑ûÈì∂Ë°åÔºåÂÆâÂæΩÈì∂Ë°åÔºå
14. It's becoming less safe to deposit cash in China's banks . The entire banking system , including the big four state - owned banks , are now restricting withdrawals or online transactions . Just to update my personal information with the bank (Âª∫ËÆæÈì∂Ë°å) , it took them literally 2 hours asking me so many personal questions like how much I earn, how much does my family earn, do I use the money for business or for personal use only , etc.
15. People are not protected from bank defaults because the government themselves are bankrupt.
16. Your pension can just easily be stolen by the government because most cities are already bankrupt.
17. A small farmer who sells to a supermarket to earn just a couple of dollars can get fined $15,000 dollars for an unintentional use of pesticide that's over the legal limit .
18. Farmers can suddenly lose their entire crops and plantation through the sudden imposition of the "Return to Farmlands" policy. Farm management officers can suddenly destroy all the farmers' crops without previous notification.
The government should give at least one year cycle season for the farmers to change their crops without incurring too much financial losses .
19. CCP'S surveillance technology has been upgraded again. Chat records accessible with just an ID card. Total invasion of privacy.
20. Wumao army and Little Pinks are Nationalist killers of the Chinese government through Cyber Bullying caused the death of a Mother and many others.
Unveiling a Tragic Incident: Examining the CCP and its Accomplice, the "Big Picture Gang" .
21. Food safety in China has always been under fire. Gutter oil, tainted rice, poisonous milk powder, food with excessive additives, and a plaque of tainted food products have become a Chinese characteristic, creating a poisonous food chain, eventually finding its way onto the tables of the citizens.
Fake Food and Toxic Food Beyond Imagination.
Gutter oil extracted from filthy sewage, juice made from rotten apples, snacks packed without wearing gloves, dried squid covered with flies, chicken feet directly stepped on with boots, soaking unripe bananas in ripening agent, kneading dough barefooted, and making chili sauce out in the open. A worker who is spraying a ripening agent on the sugarcanes says "he doesn't care if people are poisoned or not, his goal is to simply to sell them", and the lady making gutter oil says she is following legal procedures.
22. Tofu dregs are everywhere in China. They can suddenly kill you . Poor Construction quality , poor engineering, lack of safety, negligence like in Qiqihar Middle School, theme park disasters, wall tiles falling off , poor drainage systems like in Zhengzhou, nationwide flooding, overflowing dams, weekly gas explosions, etc .
23. Your life savings can suddenly disappear .
Your life savings can suddenly be stolen by the bank , by the government. Many depositors have had millions stolen from their bank accounts.
24. The Chinese government will intentionally not warn people before releasing the dam water , so that they will not be responsible for compensation based on property damages or death of the residents. You can get caught in a deadly flash flood.
25. When your relatives die you cannot get their money from the bank. It will be confiscated by the government.
26. One can easily get caught in a nuclear fallout just like what happened in September 2023 in inner Mongolia where 800 people suffered radiation poisoning. Several people died at the mining site where radiation leaked. While the general population got exposed to radiation during the storm.
27. The Chinese government never arranged for the evacuation of their citizens in war-torn areas.
In times of conflict or War the Chinese government doesn't care about its citizens.
Russian Ukraine War
Hamas Israel War
Palestine Israel War
28. When you help someone in need as a good Samaritan, you'll get into big trouble when the victim sues you for bodily injury that you didn't cause and for financial compensation.
29. Savings may suddenly disappear from your bank account.
30. Millions of babies and Young children are kidnapped every year without a trace.
31. An ordinary person can be arrested for espionage by simply taking pictures of sceneries or by taking down notes on maps , unknowingly designated as secret facilities, government facilities, or military bases .
32. The judicial system doesn't interpret the Law but rather, the CCP decides the interpretation of the law. The supreme court is just an employee of the CCP. And the CCP makes sure to make very vague laws, so that it can easily be manipulated.
33. Almost all the apartments have steel bars on windows , including school dormitories. They look like prison cells because of frequent burglaries.
34. You can get fined for doing household chores.
35. You can freeze to death during winter because the farm management police will confiscate your coal.
36. It is illegal to say China is poor.
37. It is illegal to talk about China's bad economy or worsening economy.
38. It is illegal to carry White Paper because of the White Paper Movement.
39. When there are major natural disasters like flash floods and earthquakes , there will be not enough rescue efforts from the government because of incompetence and corruption. The aid will be stolen by officials or diverted for personal gain. Canada Goose donations were sold online for profit instead of donated to the victims.
Total lockdowns can breakdown supply channels and starve people in their homes like the Zero COVID Policy imposed in 2021 to 2023.
40. When you become Rich , your company can suddenly be pirated from you by the government, just like what happened to Lan Shili , richest man in Hubei province, and Jack Ma of Ant Shares and Alibaba Group.
Pirate Company
Legal Persecution
41. Ordinary people including lawyers suddenly get blacklisted for honestly helping someone just because it's not within the CCP's narrative. 8.54 million people are now blacklisted under China's social credit system.
42. A Chinese-Australian was sentenced to death for writing the truth about China.
Australia's Foreign Minister Huang Yingxian wrote in a statement that China on Monday sentenced Australian citizen Yang Hengjun to a suspended death sentence, five years after he was first detained on national security charges.
Yang Hengjun was sentenced to death, too cruel! Highlights the influence of China‚Äôs real No. 2 figure | Jinyiwei is popular in China, and the reincarnation of autocracy has not changed for thousands of years.

snippet.textDisplay:
I am surprised that your train tickets to Hong Kong were unable to obtain the 144 hours visa, so I looked up the customs documents in Chinese. I think the possible reason is that the train station where you departed for Hong Kong does not have a qualified departure port.
According to the customs explanation, there are only four railroad ports that can be used as departure points for Guangzhou's 144 hours visa. I looked up their corresponding train stations and found that there are only two train stations in Guangdong Province where you can actually leave the country by train: Guangzhou East Railway Station and Changping Railway Station. The remaining two railway stations are under renovation and out of service now.
Many major cities in China have more than one train station in each city because of their large populations. And there are more than these two train stations in Guangdong province that you can take a train to Hong Kong, so I'm guessing that's why your train ticket to Hong Kong isn't recognized, but instead your train ticket to Macau is recognized. If this logic is correct, your train to Macau would leave from the Guangzhou East Railway Station or the Changping Railway Station.
The 144 hours visa in other places shouldn't be so complicated.But Hong Kong and Macau are so special as they are considered departures but they belong to China and have extra Chinese travelers, so there are ports that additionally serve Chinese people rather than foreigners. Besides, the 144 hours visa is usually obtained at the airport and entry/exit mostly through the airport, you guys chose to leave the country by rail which is also the reason why the visa becomes complicated.
Hope the information I've provided can help and wish you guys a great time in China.
snippet.textOriginal:
I am surprised that your train tickets to Hong Kong were unable to obtain the 144 hours visa, so I looked up the customs documents in Chinese. I think the possible reason is that the train station where you departed for Hong Kong does not have a qualified departure port.
According to the customs explanation, there are only four railroad ports that can be used as departure points for Guangzhou's 144 hours visa. I looked up their corresponding train stations and found that there are only two train stations in Guangdong Province where you can actually leave the country by train: Guangzhou East Railway Station and Changping Railway Station. The remaining two railway stations are under renovation and out of service now.
Many major cities in China have more than one train station in each city because of their large populations. And there are more than these two train stations in Guangdong province that you can take a train to Hong Kong, so I'm guessing that's why your train ticket to Hong Kong isn't recognized, but instead your train ticket to Macau is recognized. If this logic is correct, your train to Macau would leave from the Guangzhou East Railway Station or the Changping Railway Station.
The 144 hours visa in other places shouldn't be so complicated.But Hong Kong and Macau are so special as they are considered departures but they belong to China and have extra Chinese travelers, so there are ports that additionally serve Chinese people rather than foreigners. Besides, the 144 hours visa is usually obtained at the airport and entry/exit mostly through the airport, you guys chose to leave the country by rail which is also the reason why the visa becomes complicated.
Hope the information I've provided can help and wish you guys a great time in China.

snippet.textDisplay: Chinese people worship Americans? What do you worship Americans for? The history of American prosperity? American culture? Or American weapons? Are you a modern person? The reason why the United States regards China as an enemy is simple, because China has already influenced the hegemonic position of the US dollar. The value of the US dollar is not related to gold, and it is based on the influence of the United States. If the United States is no longer the world's number one, then the US dollar will also lose its current credibility. The United States not only sees China as an enemy, but also once saw Britain as an enemy, Japan as an enemy, the European Union as an enemy, and Russia as an enemy. All of these regions have had prosperous economies, and their development has posed a challenge to the United States' position. The United States has dealt with them one by one, and now it's China's turn, that's all. If China is defeated, then the next world's second largest will still be seen as an enemy of the United States. It can be any country, regardless of its name, culture, people, regime, or system. It only depends on whether its economic status will affect the United States.

snippet.textDisplay: Welcome to Guangzhou, my birthplace, from a Chinese American.  Guangzhou is the capital city of Guangdong province and has more than 2000 years of history. It was the capital of Nanyue Kingdom established by Qin Dynasty general Zhao Tuo who also started the Vietnamese Trieu Dynasty (Zhao Dynasty in Chinese), where rice noodles fen (pho in Vietnamese) was invented.  Among the Eight Major Regional Chinese Culinary Styles, Cantonese cuisine is the most well known both domestically (with a famous saying ‚Äúeat in Guangzhou‚Äù) and abroad, as Cantonese immigrants with their port opened to the world, immigrated all over the world bringing Cantonese Chinen abroad.  So you are at the birthplace of Cantonese cuisine with signature Cantonese dishes like char siu (which the Japanese adopted and call it chashu), dim sum, roasted duck/goose, Claypot rice, roasted suckling pig, cow internal organ stew, etc.  Beijing, Shanghai, Guangzhou and Shenzhen are the first four tiered cities in China.  Take a night cruise ride on the Pearl River Zhujiang to enjoy the night views of Guangzhou.  Guangzhou is also the birthplace of Donnie Yen who played Ip Man in the Ip Man movie series.  You should visit a nearby city, the ancestral home of Bruce Lee (also my paternal ancestral home) called Shunde, where they train Cantonese chefs and where you can enjoy Cantonese yusheng (similar to sashimi), Claypot congee hotpot, and double skinned milk as a dessert.  Enjoy your trip in China to dismiss all the misinformation and lies you have heard on American and western media and propaganda channels intentionally demonizing China.  Seeing is believing.  Blessings and Happy Chinese New Year from a Cantonese Chinese American who grew up in Boston and currently live in Los Angeles and who is tired of all the lies the American media spread about China.

Thank you so much for doing a series of vlogs exploring & sharing about China.. üôèüèºüôèüèºüôèüèº

As a Filipino-Chinese, and with the current political dynamics, with perspectives that are highly influenced by Western-media, it is a frustration of mine that China has been misrepresented for so long.. I know this is not the place for this, but I just want to put it out there, that I do not approve of what our Philippine government & local media do to aggravate the issues on contested territories & overtly pushing for war on this side of the globe.. I regret having supported the incumbent President into power (#BUDOLisreal), because I believed & was deceived by his promise to continue his predecessor's foreign policy to stay neutral between the superpowers US & China.. So I'm thankful to vloggers like you who can make a difference and shed light, even to my fellow Filipinos & Filipino-Chinese, how not everything (esp. the extremely negative & hostile ones) that the Western media says about China is true..

Sincere thanks to both of you.. Maraming salamat po.. Ë∞¢Ë∞¢!!

snippet.textDisplay:
The 144-hour visa free facility for Guangdong has certain limitations regarding exit border points, and unfortunately the only operating ‚ÄúHong Kong West Kowloon‚Äù train(high speed for G and C numbered trains) border checkpoint between Shenzhen and Hong Kong is not included. All other previously operating(and approved exit points for the 144 visa free facility) train(normal speed for Z numbered trains) border points has not seen trains running since the pandemic. That is why they advised you to buy a ferry or air ticket. According to Timatic: Nationals of USA with a confirmed onward air, cruise or train ticket to a third country within 144 hours, starting from 00:01 on the day following the day of entry. They must:
- arrive at one of the following airports: Guangzhou (CAN), Shantou (SWA) or Shenzhen (SZX); and
- depart from one of the following locations: Guangzhou (CAN), Meixian (MXZ), Shantou (SWA), Shenzhen (SZX), Zhanjiang (ZHA), Dongguan Humen Sea Port, Dongguan Railway Port, Doumen Sea Port, Foshan Gaoming Sea Port, Foshan Railway Port, Guangzhou Sea Port, Guangzhou Tianhe Railway Port, Heshan Sea Port, Jiuzhou Sea Port, Jiangmen Sea Port, Lianhuashan Sea Port, Nansha Sea Port, Rongqi Sea Port, Shekou Sea Port, Shenzhen Airport Support Sea Port, Shenzhen Bay Port, Shenzhen Futian Port, Shenzhen Huanggang Port, Shenzhen Luohu Port, Shenzhen Shatoujiao Port, Shenzhen Wenjindu Port, Wanchai Sea Port, Wanshan Sea Port, Zhaoqing Railway Port, Zhongshan Sea Port, Zhuhai Gongbei Port or Zhuhai Hengqin Port; and
- have documents required for the next destination.

snippet.textDisplay: I did some research about the rail exits. There are 4 stations listed as the exit ports of 144h-transit in Guangdong province. All of them are along the Guangzhou-Kowloon line connecting Guangzhou and Hong Kong. It's not high speed rail, and it operated for decades, but it stopped service since COVID, and never resumed. That's why you weren't allowed to choose train. Now the high speed rail is very popular, and there are rumors that this regular speed service will be cancelled permanently. The information online about rail exit is indeed confusing. Even the official website of Chinese immigration did not update this information and is still linking to a Guangdong Police webpage that was created in 2019.
snippet.textOriginal: I did some research about the rail exits. There are 4 stations listed as the exit ports of 144h-transit in Guangdong province. All of them are along the Guangzhou-Kowloon line connecting Guangzhou and Hong Kong. It's not high speed rail, and it operated for decades, but it stopped service since COVID, and never resumed. That's why you weren't allowed to choose train. Now the high speed rail is very popular, and there are rumors that this regular speed service will be cancelled permanently. The information online about rail exit is indeed confusing. Even the official website of Chinese immigration did not update this information and is still linking to a Guangdong Police webpage that was created in 2019.

snippet.textDisplay: On why you couldn't show your departure from mainland by booking a train ticket to HK, I just searched for some news, and it looks like it was indeed not an allowed route for the purpose of the 144-hour transit when you were there, but it should be now. The rule in Guangdong is that you must enter / exit at specifically designated checkpoints, and from April 16th they've added Hong Kong West Kowloon station as an allowed exit point. I don't know why this has to be so precise. Some people in the comments say you should do your research etc., but I can totally see how it can be a challenge for people who don't speak Chinese to find the authoritative and up-to-date info (honestly for Chinese people ourselves it doesn't always work that well either).
snippet.textOriginal: On why you couldn't show your departure from mainland by booking a train ticket to HK, I just searched for some news, and it looks like it was indeed not an allowed route for the purpose of the 144-hour transit when you were there, but it should be now.
